pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru

lessons.japanese: あの小売店のバックにはもっと大きな会社がひかえています。
lessons.english: The small retail outlet is only a front for a much larger entity.

lessons.japanese: 零細小売店などは新年度には利益を上げるでしょう。
lessons.english: Mom-and-pop stores will turn a profit in the new fiscal year.

lessons.japanese: 新型は小売価格３万円で販売される。
lessons.english: The new model will retail for 30,000 yen.

lessons.japanese: 小売物価指数は経済活動のバロメーターです。
lessons.english: The retail price index is a barometer of economic activity.

lessons.japanese: 小売商人は卸しで仕入れて小売りで売る。
lessons.english: A retail merchant buys wholesale and sells retail.

lessons.english: The small retail outlet is only a front for a much larger entity.

lessons.japanese: 小売商人は卸しで仕入れて小売りで売る。
lessons.english: A retail merchant buys wholesale and sells retail.

lessons.english: The retail price index is a barometer of economic activity.

lessons.japanese: 新型は小売価格３万円で販売される。
lessons.english: The new model will retail for 30,000 yen.

lessons.japanese: 零細小売店などは新年度には利益を上げるでしょう。
lessons.english: Mom-and-pop stores will turn a profit in the new fiscal year.

lessons.japanese: 小売部門は厳しい四半期を迎えた。
lessons.english: The retail sector had a rough quarter.
